Description: Fragment of triple-reeded handle of East Greek pottery oenochoe. Sides glazed; rows of dots, becoming short horizontals as they descend, down each reed, terminated above by double line; traces of volutes to either side of lip join.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the National Museum of Scotland. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.416)
CVA Edinburgh / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum National Museums of Scotland Edinburgh (p. 4 and pl. 11, 13)
